DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Administration Route Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the physiological path or method of introducing the substance into or onto the subject. EXAMPLE(S): oral, intravenous. The approach site might be "mouth", but from a route code perspective, this could include: swallow, oral rinse, oral topical application, chew, oral dissolve, oral inhalation (via intermittent flow or rebreather mask). The effect of the drug could vary depending on the route even if the body site happens to be the same. NOTE(S): Route is more than just approach site. It deals with how the body will actually absorb/receive the drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Administration Route Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:A way of getting from one place to another; an established line of travel or access; the way a chemical or pollutant enters an organism after contact, particularly, the way of drug administration.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
